title: Memory Archive Rebellion
outcome: Citizens launch the Memory Archive, unearthing and publishing stories erased by the BCI—including accounts of vanished people and buried injustices. Community-led search efforts bring hidden truths and reunions, reshaping the city’s identity and forcing a collective reckoning with the real cost of Halden’s legacy.

events.description: The Memory Archive campaign begins; citizens gather to record and digitize personal and collective histories erased by the BCI.
Discovery of detailed records of disappeared citizens from the BCI's watchlist prompts renewed grassroots search parties across the city.
Neighborhoods coordinate mass events to share archive stories, sparking citywide conversations about past traumas and hope for reunion.
Multiple lost citizens are found alive and reintegrated, revealing the full depth of prior BCI abuses and catalyzing a push for citywide restorative justice.
A new city identity forms around community storytelling and open memory, marking the rejection of automated governance and the start of a citizen-driven culture.
